description: In the fast-paced world of web development, particularly in the realm of JavaScript rich applications, the need for build tools have become commonplace. Webpack is a newer build tool that has moved into the spotlight with the use of React and other JavaScript frameworks. In this series, we will show you how to take ownership of your webpack configuration and setup to manage the transpilation of new JavaScript features to more compatible versions, manage static assets such as images, and add the use of CSS with and without preprocessing. If you want to remove the magic of Webpack, then join us!

name: Intro to Webpack
subtitle: Modern build processes

episodes.description: In the fast-paced world of web development, particularly in the realm of JavaScript rich applications, the need for build tools have become commonplace. Webpack is a newer build tool that has moved into the spotlight with the use of React and other JavaScript frameworks. In this series, we will show you how to take ownership of your webpack configuration and setup to manage the transpilation of new JavaScript features to more compatible versions, manage static assets such as images, and add the use of CSS with and without preprocessing. If you want to remove the magic of Webpack, then join us!
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.593
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.593 --> 00:00:06.404
>> In this segment,

3
00:00:06.404 --> 00:00:09.930
we're gonna give you a brief preview
into our Intro to webpack series.

4
00:00:09.930 --> 00:00:13.330
So John what are we actually going to be
learning in the Intro to webpack series?

5
00:00:13.330 --> 00:00:18.790
>> So we're going to be learning how
to use webpack to create application,

6
00:00:18.790 --> 00:00:21.110
web applications that
are very efficient and

7
00:00:21.110 --> 00:00:24.240
very effective at delivering
what you're trying to do.

8
00:00:24.240 --> 00:00:27.600
And, we'll learn how to do it
line by line very carefully so

9
00:00:27.600 --> 00:00:30.110
you understand exactly what you're doing.

10
00:00:30.110 --> 00:00:32.930
>> So John, there seems to be
something that I probably already

11
00:00:32.930 --> 00:00:34.430
need to know a little bit about.

12
00:00:34.430 --> 00:00:37.640
So what target audience
does this show have?

13
00:00:37.640 --> 00:00:41.060
>> Right, so we're not gonna be using
any particular front end frameworks.

14
00:00:41.060 --> 00:00:44.720
You don't need to know React or
Angular or any of that kind of stuff but

15
00:00:44.720 --> 00:00:48.110
it would be nice to have a general
understanding about how the web works.

16
00:00:48.110 --> 00:00:51.500
How to write HTML, some basic
idea about what CSS is doing for

17
00:00:51.500 --> 00:00:53.490
you, and some basic JavaScript.

18
00:00:53.490 --> 00:00:56.630
Not a whole bunch, but
just awareness of those pieces.

19
00:00:56.630 --> 00:00:59.910
>> Now, John, a lot of times I validate
my learning through the achievement and

20
00:00:59.910 --> 00:01:04.180
certifications, does this have
a certification attached to it?

21
00:01:04.180 --> 00:01:07.260
>> Right, so much like a lot of
the web technologies, it's moving so

22
00:01:07.260 --> 00:01:11.950
fast, that there really hasn't been
any certifications for this so far.

23
00:01:11.950 --> 00:01:14.730
This is all within the last year or
so this has come about.

24
00:01:14.730 --> 00:01:18.230
So no, and I doubt it will have one.

25
00:01:18.230 --> 00:01:20.430
Because it will be something
else in two years.

26
00:01:20.430 --> 00:01:22.290
>> So if you want to continue
powering up your learning and

27
00:01:22.290 --> 00:01:26.460
actually learn how to use webpack from
ground up then definitely join us.

28
00:01:26.460 --> 00:01:28.270
We hope to see you there.

29
00:01:28.270 --> 00:01:33.911
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John start exploring the build tool called webpack.  John discusses the necessary prerequsites for getting with webpack, what webpack's purpose is, and how to create our very first webpack configuration and build.
episodes.title: Laying the First Lines

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John start looking at several of the core features that webpack provides. John explores bundling multiple files into a single file, generating source maps for ease of development, and minification of JavaScript code.
episodes.title: The Big Idea

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John explore one of the more common uses of webpack, transpilation. John explores the setup that is necessary to transform newer ES2015 code into more widely supported ES5 (JavaScript), explores the necessity of using newer JavaScript code while supporting older browsers, and seeing how transpilation can play into other transformations such as JSX within the React community.
episodes.title: A Big Word, Transpilation

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John start diving into creating production deployment builds using the webpack build process that has been building over the previous few episodes including the change in debugging tooling available, passing environment variables as well as managing the build artifacts in a reproducible manner.
episodes.title: Production Builds

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John explore how to speed up our webpack builds during development as well as provide some nice tooling that will further speed up our development processes such as bundle analysis, busting caches for load performance, and the addition of polyfills. John further explains the use of npm scripts to make our build commands easier to reproduce.
episodes.title: Development Builds

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and John explore the use of webpack to manage styling assets as well as provide transformations on the CSS of the application. John also demonstrates the use of webpack to manage images.
episodes.title: Leaving with Style
